name: Hampton Inn Princeton

reviews.text: It was very nice not to have to get back out in the traffic for Dinner after a long day of business and travel. The complementary salad bar and dinner was clean, fresh and quite good. Zoraima, the dinner host, made sure of it. This will definately be my place to stay for future business travel in the Princeton area.
reviews.title: A great place to unwind after a long business day.
Great room and service ....
reviews.text: Wonderful service all around. The room was clean, roomy and modern. Service was excellent. They provided a shuttle to the train station since we were going from there to NYC for the weekend. Kevin, the driver, helped us get our train tickets and explained how the train system works. He was extremely helpful. The complementary breakfast and light dinner with wine was very well done by Zoraima. It was nice to be able to get a bite to eat there without going back out. We would highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Princeton. Whoever is managing this hotel is evidently doing an excellent job.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a wonderful night at Princeton on our way to NY. The service was really great, from the reception area personnel to the shuttle driver. We did not remember that a light dinner was included, but our dinner host, Zoraima, fixed a lovely and delicious light meal that night and good breakfast the next day. Our room was great and we would recommend the place. We have stayed in some very expensive hotels, but never have we had a warmer experience than at this Hampton Inn.
reviews.title: Never had better service regardless of price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a nice stay in November for 1 night at this hotel. The accomodations were clean and spacious and located close to Princeton University (10 min drive). Ample parking and good free hot/cold breakfast buffet. Would recommend and return to this hotel. Would improve in room lighting, esp over the sink/vanity - that's about it.
reviews.title: Nice stay at Hampton Inn Princeton

reviews.text: Our family reserved rooms at the Hampton Inn, some in our party had a medical emergency and had to cancel at the last minute. The General Manager was courteous and professional, even taking my call on his cellphone!! Most of all he was human and empathetic to our emergency. He worked with us and made us feel welcome without even being there!!
reviews.title: Spirit of Hospitality at it's best!!

reviews.text: Not within walking distance of Princeton University. No shuttle service on Saturday = expensive taxi service (no metered taxis?). New property. Workout room adequate. Why a 200 character minimum? I'm a man of few words.
reviews.title: Hampton Inn Standard

reviews.text: Room was very large and quiet for being on the first floor next to the lobby and breakfast area. Availability of breakfast for the group was a plus since our schedule was packed. Food choices met everyones needs. Desk staff very helpful in providing area information.
reviews.title: Excellent location for brief stay.

reviews.text: From the moment we checking in the front desk and staff was fantastic. They blocked our rooms together, the management allowed us to watch the Final 4 basketball game in their comfortable lounge area, (there was 30 of us!) the breakfast staff kept the food plentiful (how they did that I don't know with all the teams and guests), rooms were so clean, and best of all 2 miles to campus!
reviews.title: A must stay at near Princeton Campus

reviews.text: A Hampton Inn, unless renovated, can be ordinary. While this Hampton was not fancy, their service was fantastic, location wonderful, and rooms comfortable.
reviews.title: It was the little things that made the stay wonderful
Excellent Hotel, BUS FRIENDLY
reviews.text: It was an extremely chilly -5 day or so during the week in January during my stay that I came back, frozen a bit from the wind bite, and found a completely stocked Hot Chocolate bar waiting in the lobby, with real whipped cream, Hot Hot chocolate in urns, and both chocolate shavings and crushed peppermint bark to add in. WOW! That made my day beyond measure :-)

This hotel continues to provide an excellent experience. The entire property is extremely clean and the room was spotless. Towels and sheets smell especially fresh. Breakfast was very good and well-tended by two polite and conscientious employees. Wifi is fast and free. We will continue to stay here when we visit Princeton.
reviews.title: Extremely clean with outstanding service

reviews.text: As a frequent business traveler to the area and a guest at most of the local hotels, I can say that the staff here is the friendliest and the service is most consistent. The shuttle is by far the most convenient of the local hotels (Arlene and Kevin are very friendly and awesome drivers!). Hampton Inn makes the frequent travel much easier. thanks!
reviews.title: best service

reviews.text: I was booked to stay at the Homewood Suites by Hilton in Princeton but they could not accommodate my request for a non smoking room, so I decided to check out the Hampton just two miles north of it and was pleasantly surprised at the level of service and quality this hotel provides. The rooms are clean and comfortable, fairly spacious and has a refrigerator and microwave! That's all I need really for a good stay. The staff was courteous and friendly, and always accommodating to my every needs. They also offer a hot buffet breakfast which was great, and have breakfasts from 6am to 10am every day! To top it all, they offer dinner Monday to Thursday which consists of very substantial offerings. What a real great value! It's still close to the campus, so really very convenient. And oh their pantry is well stocked with everything from bottles of wines to snacks and dinners. I will definitely make this my main hotel in Princeton.
reviews.title: A great place to stay in Princeton

reviews.text: During the beginning of March 2013, my mother-in-law was hospitalized! Her son (my husband) and I tried to get a reasonable price from Homewood Suites-where we had stayed before, but had no luck. Hilton.com suggested we try the Hampton Inn, Princeton and they made our reservation for us. We drove from Massachusetts to New Jersey and arrived exhausted and were given a room upgrade, as we are Hilton Honor members.
reviews.title: Going the extra mile!

reviews.text: Our room was lovely, clean and well thought out. It also included a small refridgerator and microwave. Near the front desk, the hotel offered frozen dinners, wine and other foods and sundrees for sale. The hotel provided a delicious breakfast each morning and dinner on Monday-Thursday, also wonderfully prepared and quite tasty.
reviews.title: Hampton Inn Princeton

reviews.text: We were in town for my daughter's Westminster Choir College Christmas concert and were very glad we chose to stay here. As mentioned by other reviewers, the entire staff was friendly and professional, and check-in was very quick. The rooms are not your typical Hampton layout, rather, the bed is in an alcove, giving the room the feeling of being larger and quieter. Both the room and the public areas were spotlessly clean and fresh-smelling, and we were impressed that we had a microwave and refrigerator. This hotel is well-suited to longer business stays. Breakfast was beautifully arranged and everything was fresh. Coffee/tea were available all day in a comfortable great room near the front desk. Location on Route 1 is excellent, within 10 minutes of both the Westminster Choir College and Princeton Univ. campuses. Our daughter is only a freshman, so we'll be back!
reviews.title: A step up from the usual Hampton!

reviews.text: I am a regular guest at this location due to business bringing me to this area on a weekly basis for the past three years. I can't say enough about how great this hotel is. The front desk staff are amazing; friendly, couteous, helpful and they always have a smile of their faces. It has the typicaly solid Hampton Inn breakfast, but they also have a nightly dinner/reception provided at no cost. The food is actually good. It's fresh, has flavor and if you don't feel like going out and dealing with the wonderful traffic on US1, it's a great alternative. The rooms and the hotel are exceptionally clean...always. The rooms were recently redone, DirecTV added and they seem to continue to make small upgrades that make staying here easy. (i.e. they added additional outlets w/USB ports that make charging my iPad, iPhone and laptop easy)
reviews.title: Simply...Stay here.

reviews.text: Home is always better, but the people at this Hampton Inn make it a lot easier to be away.
reviews.title: Hampton Inn Employees

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Hampton Inn Princeton and I must say I never met a nicer bunch of people. The check in was so organized that they had my key ready when I gave them my card. They recently had a power outage and I got there just as it came back on so it took a little time for the cleaning folks to continue thier work but they hurried to get me a room and to make sure I was comfortable. The thing I love the most is the food they serve in the morning and espeacily the dinner in the evening Loraina cooks and sets up such a great spread I have never seen anything like this from a hotel that just gives it to thier guest. These people really make the hotel stand out from all the other hotels I ever been in.
reviews.title: Good customer service

reviews.text: We were very pleased with the service at Hampton Inn, Princeton, NJ. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Eric Williams was very courteous and professional in providing breakfast for us each morning. His willingness to serve made an impression on us. We would definitely recommend your hotel to our friends and family members!
reviews.title: Another FABULOUS experience!!

reviews.text: I booked a room for a high school reunion in Princeton. The Hampton not only met but, exceeded all my expectations. It really set a wonderful tone for my three day stay in mid October 2012. The room had everything I needed, microwave, fridge, free LAN and wireless internet connectivity, LED TV, etc. The pool and lobby areas at the hotel are fantastic (clean and well appointed) as well. The free buffet breakfast was top notch compared to other free hotel continental breakfasts. On top of this all the staff was very professional, efficient, friendly and inviting. They offer free transportation from the hotel to almost all of the hotspots in the area as well as picking you up when you are ready to return. The drivers, the maids, the reception staff all made my experience one to remember and because of them, I will always stay at the Hampton Inn when I travel to Princeton area. Thank you Joe H.!!!
reviews.title: The Best!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband I got married in Princeton and chose this hotel to set aside a block of rooms. All of our guests were extremely happy with the rooms and the service (as were we!)
reviews.title: Amazing place with incredible service

reviews.text: We were supplied with free shuttle service for both the rehearsal dinner and the wedding which was a huge help especially with family members averse to the use of computers and google maps! They also kept the outside bar open for us and our guests for a great after-party the night of the wedding which was a great way to end the evening.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful and Joseph Horowitz was just great both during the planning stages and our actual stay. People, if you need a place to stay near Princeton, this is the place!
reviews.title: Nice hotel.

reviews.text: Exactly as outside of town hotel should be - new, clean, spacious, friendly. Free wired and wireless Internet in room, free (and good) breakfast, good rooms, great service. Great choice (thanks, TripAdvisor reviewers!)
reviews.title: Nice property, affordable, unremarkable

reviews.text: I stayed here for a night while visiting my son at Princeton University. A very nice Hampton Inn about 5 miles from the university. My room was a nice size, clean with an excellent shower. I slept very well here. Best breakfast that I've had at any Hampton, and I've stayed at many.
reviews.title: Nice Stay in Princeton

reviews.text: The Princeton Hampton Inn is always a great place to stay. The rooms are very nice -clean and nicely appointed- and a value for the cost. The breakfast is always very good with a variety of items available. It's nice that the lobby has convenience items (wine1) available.
reviews.title: Consistently a nice stay

reviews.text: This hotel is reasonably convenient to the campus, and offers the great combination of value, service, cleanliness and amenities which I've come to take for granted with Hampton Inns. The price includes both a continental breakfast and a buffet dinner. And even at peak times, there never seemed to be much of a wait, either at the front desk or in the dining area. I'd recommend this hotel as a consistent good value.
reviews.title: Great value for visiting Princeton

reviews.text: This Hampton Inn in Princeton is conveniently located and as with all Hamptons, has a great staff. Love staying at Hampton when in this area. The breakfast is always good, and even with a large group there on the weekend, is kept well-stocked and clean. The staff is ALWAYS more than willing to accommodate your needs, and with a SMILE (not a common thing these days)!
reviews.title: Gotta Love Hampton Inns

reviews.text: Was very pleased with service, accomodations, and breakfast. Will definitly stay here again. I would enjoy to have the same room if possible on future stays. Even the person that I roomed with said this should be the place where we'll stay when we come for our religious gathering.
reviews.title: Survey of Hotel Stay

reviews.text: Nice arrangement with Princeton University for school visits. Great service and supper comfortable beds! Fitness center is tiny. Excellent service at the breakfast. Outdoor pool was not yet open (Early April)
reviews.title: Princeton Hampton

reviews.text: I am a Hampton Inn fan, but the friendliness and service at this hotel was aces. If you find yourself at the hotel, find Zoraima and Arlene and be ready to laugh and feel at home. The shuttle service was flexible and on-time. The food for the buffet was so much better than expected. This is on my "return" list.
reviews.title: Customer service is amazing.

reviews.text: The staff of this hotel is great, especially the shuttle drivers. They would provide good advice of places to visit. The Breakfast and Dinner was always great, shuttles to work site or to Princeton campus.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Its a great hotel,, Friendly staff, amazing service the rooms are big clean & comfortable. The shuttle takes you anywhere the food is available at breakfast & dinner. I liked the dinner Zoraima is a great chef & a sweet one. In future i will never go to other hotel
reviews.title: I love it

reviews.text: Each and every Hampton Inn Associate I interacted with was friendl, knowledgeable, and helpful. Made me feel "at home". The business center is located in a very accessable spot. The fitness center was top notch. Both the dinner and breakfast were geat!
reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service

reviews.text: I have stayed at other local hotels on most of my trips to Princeton but lack of availability had me try this hotel on my most recent trip. I have to say that given the price, the quality of the amenities, and the location, I will be back. I was not able to take advantage of the free breakfast or dinner on this trip but that they're included is incredible. DirecTV in the room is a really nice touch. Got here by accident, will be back here by choice in the future.
reviews.title: Surprisingly Great Value

reviews.text: excellent place to stay. location is great and the customer care is excellent as well. They had fre dinner entrees and drinks to go with. This was mainly monday thru thursday for corperate clients. We were there for a wedding and had other family members with us too. All of us enjoyed our stay with this hotel and will definitely consider coming back next year. The housekeeper we had on our floor help my wife out in doing her hair. She was great person and went beyond her call of duty. We neds to be commanded. Thanks for making our stay a great one.
reviews.title: very good place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wanting to celebrate my husband's 60th b'day at Grounds for Sculpture and by attending a McCarter Theater jazz concert, I started looking for B&B's in the area but none were available due to a Princeton football game. A little on-line research surfaced this hotel, a place I would ordinarily not have considered. After reading other reviews and seeing that they offered a "package" that included tix to the McCarter Theater, the deal was sealed. Sales Mgr, Joseph Horowitz, was completely attentive and secured us front row seats for the Vijay Iyer concert! Hotel staff was kind, courteous, and most welcoming - even gifting us a bottle of wine to celebrate the b'day. Will definitely return and, without qualms, recommend to others.
reviews.title: Unexpected Surprise

reviews.text: The level of service was more than I expected. From check in until check out, someone was always there to make sure I was comfortable and taken care of. A stand out employee was Eric, who made sure all of our meeting room needs were fulfilled.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.text: I would recommend this property to anyone and would gladly return again for business or pleasure. A must stay.
reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service

description: The Hampton Inn Princeton features 110 of the largest guest rooms in the area. By far one of the best value priced hotels in the Central NJ/Princeton area. Stay and enjoy daily "On The House" complimentary full breakfast daily, Complimentary "On The Light Side" full dinner including soup, salads, beer, wine, soda and dessert (Monday-Thursday from 5PM-7PM). Besides that, we have complimentary local transportation, over 120 new channels, the fastest internet in Princeton, outdoor pool, fire place & bar and our brand new "Jump Start Fitness" room. See for yourself and you too will become a part of our genuine family.
